ramayanam.title: The Ramayana
ramayanam.description: A chapter-by-chapter simplified retelling of the Ramayana, suitable for all ages.

chapters.name: Bala Kanda – Birth and Childhood
chapters.summary: King Dasharatha of Ayodhya has no children. With divine blessings, Rama, Bharata, Lakshmana, and Shatrughna are born. Rama grows up as an ideal prince and later marries Sita after breaking Shiva’s bow.

chapters.name: Ayodhya Kanda – Exile of Rama
chapters.summary: Rama is chosen as king, but Queen Kaikeyi demands that Bharata be crowned and Rama be sent to exile. Rama willingly leaves Ayodhya for fourteen years with Sita and Lakshmana.

chapters.name: Aranya Kanda – Life in the Forest
chapters.summary: Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana live in forests. Demoness Surpanakha is rejected, leading to conflict. Ravana abducts Sita and takes her to Lanka.

chapters.name: Kishkindha Kanda – Alliance with the Vanaras
chapters.summary: Rama befriends Sugriva and Hanuman. Sugriva regains his kingdom. Hanuman is sent to search for Sita.

chapters.name: Sundara Kanda – Hanuman’s Journey
chapters.summary: Hanuman crosses the ocean, finds Sita in Lanka, gives her Rama’s ring, and burns part of Lanka before returning.

chapters.name: Yuddha Kanda – War with Ravana
chapters.summary: Rama builds a bridge to Lanka. A great war follows. Ravana is defeated and Sita is rescued.

chapters.name: Uttara Kanda – Rama’s Rule
chapters.summary: Rama returns to Ayodhya and becomes king. After trials and separation, Sita returns to the earth. Rama rules as an ideal king.

ramayanam.message: The Ramayana teaches dharma, devotion, courage, and righteousness.
